Author: Audo#5667
Content:
The current marketing team is:
 - Steve: the marketing lead and strategist
 - Ben: Social Media and community engagement
 - Audo: I help out everywhere I can, like community building!
 - Daniel & Davion: our writers (currently part-time)
 - Bryan: animation/video (part-time)
 - Graphics: we are looking for someone to come full time

When it comes to marketing strategy, Steve would be the best guy to explain. In short, there are few things we need to have a solid foundation for effective marketing:

 - Clear vision about what our Komodo project wants to do and achieve
 - Brand architecture among all the various parts and projects we have
 - Messaging and stories to quickly explain what we do and how our tech works

The goal is to have a clear brand for Komodo. That means, that if I say "Komodo" you will think about one thing... and that one thing is the most important thing.

If I say Shapeshift, you think of an easy exchange service
If I say Ethereum, you think of a smart contract platform for developers
If I say, Stratis, you think of a blockchain provider for the enterprise

If I say Komodo, what do you think?

If we ask this from many people, I would guess we would get very diverse answers ranging from DEX, to dICO platform, to privacy coin... and that is one of the problems we have. We need to develop a clear brand and messaging for Komodo for the marketing to work.

If our community struggles to explains what we do, how can we ever grow?

At the moment it looks like we are planning to brand Komodo as an "end-to-end blockchain technology provider" that allows everyone to launch their independent blockchain.

I also want us to talk more about 'ecosystem', and that is where I believe our vision comes in. We provide technology for the whole industry to build an interoperable ecosystem. Komodo itself is not an ecosystem; it is just helping to build an ecosystem.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: (copy pasted from Reddit)

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Yes that one thing has to more or less hold everything we do inside it, and "end-to-end blockchain technology provider" pretty much does, right?

To create a powerful brand it has to be a one thing ‚Äì and it cannot change.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: yes exactly @Daiyox , that is our current plan for BarterDEX backend. It would carry its own brand and it would be "powered by Komodo"

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: I personally like "end-to-end blockchain technology provider" as primary as it is reaching out and feeding the ecosystem, the more projects using Komodo as a provider the more visibility / clout is had behind other Komodo powered projects.  The provider angle is  great marketing in a way, just as people may of initially noticed Intel after buying a PC containing its chips

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: I think in short, I just agree /votes the way you all are already thinking üòÉ

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Yes, and I can't stress the brandin value there enough. We must get hundreds and thousands of projects to use our technology. Our brand has to scream security & innovation, and we must be seen as the authority on the industry.

If we try to mix in other things it would dilute our brand value, e.g. a decentralized exchange, and even a multi-coin wallet in my personal opinion. Many of these things are still under discussion.

Take a real-life case: Lexus is a luxury car with its own branding, but it is made by Toyota.

We want to make BarterDEX its own brand, made by Komodo

Author: Audo#5667
Content: There's a very good reason why Toyota gave Lexus it's complete brand indepenence. For the same reason we are looking many other aspects in the Komodo sphere and thinking if they should get their own independent brand.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
"There's a very good reason why Toyota gave Lexus it's complete brand indepenence. "
Because no one is going to pay $100,000 for a Corolla

Author: Audo#5667
Content: in our case that's a bit more tricky, and BarterDEX backend in my opinion could be under the main Komodo brand. Both have their plust and minus sides. One other thing our team was thinking was the importance to make BarterDEX seens as an independent project so that other blockchain projects would be more happy to use the technology. If it's seens as "komodo feature" some projects might ignore it as they see us as their competitors.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
Imo:
1) it's not always a good idea to rely on the luxury car analogy (after all the difference between many GMC products and Cadillacs is smoke, mirrors, price, and perception)
2) When promoting flagship products, never forget that there are other products under that flag that appeal to other demographics (i.e., multi-coin and single coin wallets)

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: Good point, even if the technical team working another project understood BarterDEX as the obvious choice to build upon, the "suits" may overule that decision seeing it as technology of a "competitor"...Lots of stupid out there making decisions that don't make sense, so taking away obstacles that could interfere seems wise.

Author: Daiyox#2701
Content: @ComputerGenie Awesome analogy with the cars.. Lots of assets (car bodies) with the same engine, transmission, etc (drivetrain) ..Very analgous to Asset Chains built around a Primary chain
